definition: to stand out among one's peers (idiom)/to excel

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]

sentences.english: A: You need to work hard to get ahead in this company.
sentences.chinese: 在這家公司要想出人頭地，就得努力工作。

sentences.english: They know that their offspring will need English to get ahead.
sentences.chinese: 他們的後代爲了出人頭地將需要英語。

sentences.english: I never want to view myself as any different or any better than anyone else.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有想過要活得異於凡人或出人頭地。

sentences.english: After be released from prison, turn and careerism, aspire stand out.
sentences.chinese: 出獄後，轉而追求名利，立志出人頭地。

sentences.english: He desired not to be pinnacled, but to sink into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他不想出人頭地，只願深入羣衆之中。

sentences.english: He desired not to be pinnacled, but sink into the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他不想出人頭地，只願深入羣衆之中。

sentences.english: First with wit is divided into two unsuccessful preeminence.
sentences.chinese: 先把才子分爲出人頭地與懷才不遇兩種。
難道你不想出人頭地嗎？

sentences.english: A man has to strike out for himself if he wants to get ahead.
sentences.chinese: 一個人要想出人頭地，就得自己去打天下。

sentences.english: I will signalize you in the filmdom in two years.
sentences.chinese: 我將在兩年內使你在電影界出人頭地。

sentences.english: The big thing in LA seems to be fame.
sentences.chinese: 在洛杉磯，出人頭地似乎事關重大。

sentences.english: He was eager to get out of the (common) ruck and distinguish himself in some way.
sentences.chinese: 他渴望出人頭地，在某方面與衆不同。

definition: to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to struggle arduously
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
to strive for mastery (idiom); aiming for the best result/to have high ambitions
glorious and flourishing (idiom); thriving
linked in countless ways
secure employment (lit. iron rice bowl)
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
young and promising
